Public Remarks: Calling all first-time buyers, investors, and lovers of Yaletown, your chance to buy into the historic Murchies Building is here! Originally built in 1912 and reconstructed into residences in 1997, this Heritage building is perched atop the intersection of Davie and Homer in the heart of Yaletown. Public Remarks: A piece of British Columbia history, the 105 acre Decourcy Island farm remains unchanged since the early part of the last century when it played a pivotal role as the home of the notorious Brother XII. Located just south of the Gabriola Island within British Columbia's Gulf Islands, Decourcy Island is a tranquil & quiet sentinel that offers a lifestyle that is challenging to find this close to major population centres. Unlike the larger & more populated Gulf Islands, Decourcy has retained its charm & privacy due to its boat access status & residential only development. The island is home to one of BC's first marine parks & boats its own fire hall & volunteer fire department. The farm is not in the ALR.
Realtor Remarks: A piece of British Columbia history, the 105 acre Decourcy Island farm remains unchanged since the early part of the last century when it played a pivotal role as the home of the notorious Brother XII.
